intro: Tylloma brachylepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tylloma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, often in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Tylloma brachylepis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and drought tolerance.
